title: Use the right data type
sql:
-- Using the wrong data type can lead to a host of 
  -- performance problems and query errors
  create table fake_values ( 
    fake_date  varchar2(20) -- this should be DATE!
  );
  
  -- The database converts sysdate to a string
  -- using the session NLS settings 
  insert into fake_values values ( sysdate );

  select * from fake_values;

  FAKE_DATE    
  ------------
  22-AUG-2025 

  -- This indexes the string value
  create index fake_date_i 
    on fake_values ( fake_date );

  -- This query compares the string column to a date
  -- The database converts the column to a date
  -- => it does not use the index
  select * from fake_values
  where  fake_date < sysdate;

   Id  | Operation         | Name        
  ---------------------------------------
     0 | SELECT STATEMENT  |             
  *  1 |  TABLE ACCESS FULL| FAKE_VALUES 

  Predicate Information (identified by operation id):
  ---------------------------------------------------
   1 - filter(INTERNAL_FUNCTION("FAKE_DATE")<SYSDATE@!)

  -- And after changing the sessions date format
  alter session set nls_date_format = 'YYYY-MM-DD';

  -- the conversion fails => error!
  select * from fake_values
  where  fake_date < sysdate;
  ORA-01858: A non-numeric character was found 
  instead of a numeric character.
